data.sentence: The word عَنْ comes from the root ع ن and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.
data.sentence: The word الْقِيَامَةِ comes from the root ق و م and is associated with the meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.
The word وَمَنْ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From

data.meanings: day, era, time, today, this/that day, age/period of time.
data.sentence: The word يَوْمَ comes from the root ي و م and is associated with the meanings: day, era, time, today, this/that day, age/period of time.

data.meanings: to swerve from duty, stray from the right course, be or become blind, ignorant, obscure and dubious, deprive of the sight, rend abstruse, blind, dark, conceal. amaha - mental blindness, amaya - mental and physical blindness.
data.sentence: The word أَعْمَى comes from the root ع م ي and is associated with the meanings: to swerve from duty, stray from the right course, be or become blind, ignorant, obscure and dubious, deprive of the sight, rend abstruse, blind, dark, conceal. amaha - mental blindness, amaya - mental and physical blindness.

data.meanings: to remember/commemorate/recollect, study in order to remember, remind, bear in mind, mindful, mention/tell/relate, magnify/praise, admonish/warn (e.g. dhikra is the 2nd declenation and it is stronger than dhikr), preach, extol, give status.nobility/eminence/honour, fame, good report, cause of good reputation, means of exaltation.Male/man/masculine (dhakar, dual - dhakarain, plural - dhukur).
data.sentence: The word ذِكْرِي comes from the root ذ ك ر and is associated with the meanings: to remember/commemorate/recollect, study in order to remember, remind, bear in mind, mindful, mention/tell/relate, magnify/praise, admonish/warn (e.g. dhikra is the 2nd declenation and it is stronger than dhikr), preach, extol, give status.nobility/eminence/honour, fame, good report, cause of good reputation, means of exaltation.Male/man/masculine (dhakar, dual - dhakarain, plural - dhukur).

data.meanings: to live in a certain manner, pass ones' life, possessed of life, seek sustenance. ishatun - livelihood, time for seeking livelihood. ma'ishatun - existence, manner of living, rituals, necessities of life, means of life and subsistence, means of obtaining that whereby one lives.
data.sentence: The word مَعِيشَةً comes from the root ع ي ش and is associated with the meanings: to live in a certain manner, pass ones' life, possessed of life, seek sustenance. ishatun - livelihood, time for seeking livelihood. ma'ishatun - existence, manner of living, rituals, necessities of life, means of life and subsistence, means of obtaining that whereby one lives.

data.meanings: Became narrow or strait (indicate hardship). Became weak in judgment, in body, in soul, in intellect.Hard, firm, and compact in the flesh (applied to a man). Affected with a constant or chronic, pervading disease.Became redundant, increased, or augmented. Children or offspring.
data.sentence: The word ضَنْكًا comes from the root ض ن ك and is associated with the meanings: Became narrow or strait (indicate hardship). Became weak in judgment, in body, in soul, in intellect.Hard, firm, and compact in the flesh (applied to a man). Affected with a constant or chronic, pervading disease.Became redundant, increased, or augmented. Children or offspring.

data.meanings: To gather together, raise from the dead, banish.
data.sentence: The word وَنَحْشُرُهُ comes from the root ح ش ر and is associated with the meanings: To gather together, raise from the dead, banish.
